Coopamac would like to professionalize Rice business activities in order to improve the income of his member trough the selling of more quantities of rice at Bralima industry. Become a sustainable supplier of the Bralima brewery in Bukavu.

The Mashaka Agricultural Cooperative of Kilomonyi COOPAMAK exists in its present form since 2014. But its history goes back more or less thirty years.In fact it is in 1982 that seven agricultural producers of the village of Kilomonyi near the city of Uvira constitute a peasant organization with the aim of mobilizing the village community to free a part of the terroir imprisoned in the marsh and covered bushes (mashaka in Swahili) in the Ruzizi River Delta. In 1993 the peasant organization was structured and adopted a specific name: Microproject food rice Mashaka Kilomonyi (MIPROVIRIMA). It formalized the membership of 176 members and provided a staff composed of a director an agronomist and a secretary. With this technical support the members traced the irrigation channels and ensured its regular cleaning. In 2010 MIPROVIRIMA joined the Ruzizi Agricultural Producers Cooperative (COPA-Ruzizi) as a Farmers' Group with headquarters in Uvira. In 2014 members of MIPROVIRIMA left COPA-Ruzizi to found an autonomous cooperative the current COOPAMAK. It enjoys official recognition through the Provincial Inspectorate for Rural Development. The cooperative currently has 172 members who hold the General Assembly (AG) once a year. COOPAMAK was informed of the mission of Agriterra and that it made contact. She hopes to receive technical and financial support to rehabilitate her dehuller and access more profitable markets.
